conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_D and School_D is my first choice. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll and would commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.

Given full information, Student_A prefers School_B first and School_D is 4th; Student_B has School_D last; Student_C has School_D 4th. These higher-priority students are unlikely to apply to us early, but could later if rejected elsewhere. Student_D has School_D as first choice and is applying now, offering a secure match. With no other applicants in hand and only one round elapsed (plenty of time), we could reject to hold out for higher-ranked students, but that risks ending unmatched if none ever apply. Since Student_D is still on our acceptable list and is highly committed, accepting now maximizes certainty while still yielding an acceptable outcome.
